<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_file_opencfg:
```c
int lfs_file_opencfg(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_file_t *file,
        const char *path, int flags,
        const struct lfs_file_config *cfg) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_opencfg(%p, %p, \"%s\", %x, %p {"
                 ".buffer=%p, .attrs=%p, .attr_count=%"PRIu32"})",
            (void*)lfs, (void*)file, path, (unsigned)flags,
            (void*)cfg, cfg->buffer, (void*)cfg->attrs, cfg->attr_count);
    LFS_ASSERT(!lfs_mlist_isopen(lfs->mlist, (struct lfs_mlist*)file));

    err = lfs_file_opencfg_(lfs, file, path, flags, cfg);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_opencfg -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags: err = lfs_file_opencfg_(lfs, file, path, flags, cfg);
explanation: Fragments not listed do not need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 because they do not introduce pointer types that could/should be const-qualified or they already use appropriate const qualification: - The final trace and return lines (e.g. LFS_TRACE("lfs_file_opencfg -> %d", err); and return err;) do not perform pointer conversions or declare pointer types. - The path parameter is already declared as const char * and therefore satisfies the rule. - The integer flags and local integer err are non-pointer scalar types and not relevant to pointer const-qualification. - Simple use of cfg->attr_count (an integer) or formatting strings do not involve pointer type qualification. The listed fragments are those that involve pointer declarations, pointer arguments, or casts that may remove or fail to use const qualifiers and therefore warrant further inspection for compliance with Rule 8.13.
